column4: the sound dont work for me on either of my soundcards (have two)
anyone know what the problem might be?
one is a Creative X-Fi Extreme Gamer the other one is a realtech on the mobo
lol... info like _what_ card would be useful
you really want to provide people with the outputs of the following commands :  sudo lshw && lspci -vv && lsmod && lsusb
its to long not all the info fits in the terminal but here it is http://pastebin.com/zqmibkm0
do the entire command but add > ~/Desktop/output.txt to the end
then open the file on the desktop and paste the contents
i dotn get a output.txt on the Desktop and I do sudo lshw && lspci -vv && lsmod && lsusb ~/Desktop/output.txt
you missed the  > it should be sudo lshw && lspci -vv && lsmod && lsusb > ~/Desktop/output.txt
this was all i got http://pastebin.com/Lx5C7P99
doh! sudo lshw > ~/Desktop/output.txt && lspci -vv >> ~/Desktop/output.txt  && lsmod >> ~/Desktop/output.txt  && lsusb >> ~/Desktop/output.txt
here you go and sorry that im so much trouble, I realy appriciate the help http://pastebin.com/P51srASF
I have to go, but my first advice would be to turn off the onboard soundcard in the bios and try again, also post on ubuntuforums the problem and also the same content as you just pastbined
ok thx for the time tho
